result.execSummary:
The defendant Taquisha R Powell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all court costs, surcharges, DNA surcharge.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.   Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

superMiscConds.notes: Undergo mental health assessment and treatment.
No contact with victim without approval of agent or Court.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may not carry or possess any   firearms/body armor.  Court further advised defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.

records.addlTxt: Original PLEA AND SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (14 pages) commencing 10-08-2015 received and filed. CH
Invoice forwarded to Accounts Payable in the amount of $875.00 to Dr. Pankiewicz for services on 08/31, 9/1, 3, 4 of 2015
Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Taquisha R Powell in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Taquisha R Powell in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to FIRST DEGREE RECKLESSLY ENDANGERING SAFETY, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 941.30(1) , a Class F  felony.
To the amended charge:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   
 State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by all parties.
 The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 170 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS with the following conditions:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
-Undergo mental health assessment and treatment.
-AODA and maintain absolute sobriety.
-No contact with victim without approval of agent or court.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon she may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is to be given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of her appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.   
Defendant remanded.

Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz in court, defendant Taquisha R Powell not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for return on doctor's report.  Due to the contents of the report, defense withdrew their special plea.    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 38.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 08:15 am.
from Doctor Pankiewicz dated 09/07/2015 received and filed.

Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz in court, defendant Taquisha R Powell not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case set for Plea and Sentencing. Defendant's appearance waived for today's hearing. Defense entered a plea of not guilty and not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. Court ordered Dr. Pankiewicz be appointed to examine the defendant for NGI Pursuant to Wisc. stats. 971.16. Case adjourned to branch 38.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
At request of the court date changed to 8-12-2015 at 8:15.  OTP cancelled for 8-6-15 at 1:30.  New OTP completed.  Atty Schwarz is advised of date.

Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz in court, defendant Taquisha R Powell not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Off the record.  Due to branch 4 in trial, case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing Hearing in Branch 38 on 8-6-2015 at 1:30 pm.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.   mld

Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz in court, defendant Taquisha R Powell not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Case adjourned for Plea Hearing in Branch 4 on 6-16-2015 at 1:30 pm.   mld

Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court waived the appearance of defendant upon the request of defense counsel.  Today, the recorded statement by defendant and Inventory List was turned over to defense counsel by the State. Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 6-3-2015 at 8:30 am.  mld

Defendant Taquisha R Powell in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Taquisha R Powell in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  The State turned over the discovery to defense counsel.  Offer will be forthcoming to defense counsel, per the State.  Court ordered case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 5-21-2015 at 1:30 pm.  mld

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Earnestine MB

Defendant Taquisha R Powell in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Taquisha R Powell in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
